description: From Ancient Greek ὀξέᾱ (oxéā). Either from the Ionic form of Attic ὀξεῖᾰ (oxeîa), (a feminine form of ὀξῠ́ς (oxús, “sharp”) applied to ῥᾰ́βδος (rhábdos, “wand; shaft”)) or a variant of ὀξῠ́ᾱ (oxúā), ὀξῠ́η (oxúē, “beech; spear-shaft”).

nouns.description: oxea (plural oxea or oxeas or oxeae)

entries.meaning: (zoology, of sponges (Porifera)) a monoaxial spicule which is pointed at both ends
